text: Pours a gorgeous deep black underneath a giant beige head leaving tons of lace. Nose is citrus-mocha, roasted and fruity with a notable hoppy back. Taste walks the line between hoppy porter and black IPA (as do most entrants in the style), with a huge roasted malt base topped by loads of citric-pine hop madness. Mild sweetness gets quickly overrun by the massive waves of resinous, clingy hop vitriol. Good but a bit abrasive. (5/2011)

this review is for a 2013 model, so more than 3 years old. didnt expect much since Ive had it fresh and its amazing. but found this and gave it a shot. - pours opaque brown with minimal crema-like colored thin head. on the nose, dates, plums, stale wet cardboard, some umami and soy sauce. not good.
taste is muted roasted malts, toffee, molasses with off-flavors of wet cardboard. bitterness is still prominent but in a very harsh way. mouth feel is medium full, with medium carbonation and oily, rich texture. the aftertaste is a lingering bitter harshness. -

Bottle into tulip. Black w decent head. Strong resinous hop aroma and taste. Some muting of the hop by the dark malt but still unmistakably an IPA. I am not a huge hop fan but thought to give it a whirl. I Will not go back to it any time soon as too hoppy but can see why hop heads like it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A dense, unwavering dark pour that holds up a brightly sandy head. Beautiful. Notes of roasted coffee and chocolate waft from a distance. A closer nose reveals the amazing tropical citrus, mango, papaya, and floral lemon. The flavor starts round and robustly dark, medium plus body, chocolate and light roast coffee, all surrendering to a floral, lemon, tangerine and lifted pine. The floral, rindy, and dark chocolate linger echo beyond the sip. Ive had this one fresh, and Ive had this one not-so-fresh. Both have been great.

Has a delicious smoky nose, and its black ink pour into a 6oz glass with a thick, frothy pour is very attractive. The mouthfeel is smooth, and the balance of malt and hops is masterful. I realize that the black IPA is an acquired taste, but Stone has truly hit the zenith. Cheers!
Pours a nice cola color, aroma is pine, toffee and some roasted notes. The taste is quite bitter throughout. Some citrus as well. Excellent black IPA
Bottle. Opaque with an off-white head and lacing. Aroma is light citrus and pine, with some roasted malt flavoring. Medium bodied. Slightly bitter.

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass from Signal Variety. Aroma is caramel, roast, dark fruit, citrus, light chocolate. Appearance is dark brown/mahogany--almost black--with finger-width light brown creamy head with fair retention and nice lacing. Taste is as aroma with late fruit/earthy bitterness, mild alcohol. Palate is medium-to-full bodied, with airy/foamy texture, lively carbonation and mix of sweet and bitter roasted finish. Overall, complex and very good but it goes a bit more to the heavy DIPA side of things than the lighter IPA side, which I would like a bit better.

From QC. Dark opaque reddish-brown black with beige bubbly head and wet streaky lacing. Smells of dusty dry malt, moderate stony slightly vegetal bitterness, some bready spicy dark rye and light plum. Taste is heavy bitter burnt malt, lightly puckering/dry and moderately spicy. Body is bitter, slick, moderately citric and spicy. Very bitter, stony verging on vegetal. Good but not amongst my favourite black IPAs.

Bottle from QClub at home. Bottled 5/24/16 but preparing for not super fresh given QClub shipping. Slightly transparent cola brown pour. Finely bubbled light tan head. Aroma is some trademark Stone resin, but a lot of dark somewhat musty malt too - like the Brewcraft shop almost. Perhaps a bit off. Taste is similar - dank resin hops with boozy bite and lots of malt. Very good, though as exciting as I hoped. It may be a bit less fresh. Still very good, especially for hk$30.

A beer with a special meaning to me. One of my closest friends growing up passed away 3 years ago. During our last conversation he recomended this beer to me - his favorite. I never had a chance to try it, and just a few months later, it was announced as retired by Stone. Disappointed, of course, but then I actually found a bottle - in the cellar of my late friends broher-in-law. He graciously accepted to share it with me. 
Black color. Chocolate aromas, some hops. Very smooth taste, dark malt, chocolate, citrus hops (even though very mellow due to the long cellaring). Sweet taste with just a slight bitter finish from the hops.

Poured a deep, deep brown bordering on black with a creamy head. Smells of citrus with undertones of pine. Tastes like a cross between an IPA and a stout with a good deal of maltiness poking through the initial bitterness. The carbonation is a little lively. The body is medium. Overall, a truly great ale.

Wonderful. Deep opaque brown poor with short tan head. Huge aroma _ cocoa, roasted beef, toffees, pine, and grapefruit. Taste Carries more of the hop charter, especially pine. Lots of chocolate with some espresso. Mouthful is thick and creamy with a long, effervescent finish. Man, this is nice.
Very balanced cross between a stout and an ipa. Charred. Nice grapefuit bitterness, that isnt over powering. I cant dispute the audacious description of this, as its accurate. Thx BlackHaddock
Really nice. Hoppy and one of the beers that sets the tone for this style. Im sorry they retired this.
Pours a dark mahogany brown with fluffy tan head. Aromas of dark malts, touch of hops, and some woody bourbon notes. Smooth malty taste to start, then hops, and a bourbon finish.

Deep clear brown, black. Deep pine resin, some deep chocolate and espresso notes. Some peppery notes. Quite bitter, a tiny bit of sweetness. Long ass finish, quite acidic, light amount of carbonation, heavier body. Good.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Well, this is fairly ridiculous. I thought I was looking this up to reminisce about this beer and see what I said about it, but apparently I never got around to rating it! Im enjoying my last bottle of it since it is now gone forever (but replaced by Enjoy By Black IPA which is also excellent). This was a great early beer by Stone and Im guessing they may do a "Encore Performance" run of it some day like theyre doing for others. Anyway, nice roasted malt aroma with lots of hoppyness coming out of a very dark brown but crystal clear body with a light tan head. Dark chocolate and cocoa up front with biting astringency following this which I think is both the hops and the alcohol working together. Earthy and citrusy, the hops really round out the dark roasted husky malt. Ends with more chocolate and cocoa on the tongue with a lasting bitter burn in the back. Farewell you sublimely self-righteous bastard, you will be missed and remembered.

12oz bottle, picked up in Tokyo (2014), and consumed on 25-Dec-2015. Stored carefully, but still BBE Mar-2015. Dark, close to black in colour with a medium sized tan coloured head, which dissipated pretty quickly. Full body and soft carbonation. Aroma of sweet malt, caramel and pine. Bitter on the palate. Flavour of sweet malt, bread, molasses - very hoppy up front. Worth the wait.

Rating #1297 21.10.2014 - On tap at Stone launch @craftbeeryeg. Pours a California back alley black with a bubbly tan head. Aroma is a violent clash between toasted malt, and floral piney hops. Taste is extremely hoppy, tempered with a pleasant coffee, chocolate, burnt sugar sweetness that disguises any alcohol on the palate and rounds out the hoppy bitterness, and is beyond refreshing. Unreal hoppy black beauty.
pours black with a huge cappuccino head. Lots of earthy smells to the aroma. A very malty taste is followed through with a hint of bitterness and a light coffee finish. This is a very nice beer.

Bottle. Pours black with light frothy beige cream head, lasting. Aroma is sweet old dank hops, yammy, mellow, roast, coffee, ripe berries, chocolate, light fruity, light herbal and grass, light candy, some wet tobacco. Aroma is reminiscent of an old oldschool IIPA. Taste is quite roasty, grassy, sweet malts, coffee, dark chocolate, old hops, light fruity, liquorice. Really balanced roast against the hops. Piny resinous finish, dry, bitter roast and hops. Lasting finish, with light tobacco. Light oily body.

Vintage bottle thanks to LukasMH (Est. 2013). Pours a dark reddish brown with a big, tan head. Aroma has roasted malts, old hops, slight grassy, not in an earthy way though. Piny, tobacco, slight strawberry, licorice, black currants. Taste suffers surprisingly little from the ageing. Sweet, malty, piny and grassy up front, bitter roasted and hoppy finish. You can tell that its old, but it is pretty darn good anyways. Oily, sharp body and an average carbonation.

Fairly dark black, border line cola color with half finger light khaki head. Smells of rye, dark malt, anise, piney hops, a little dark fruit. Taste is a dark grain/rye like bitter, burnt charred, cigarette ash, anise, a tiny bit of coffee and chocolate, pine hops. Good representation of the style

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From notes. Enjoyed on September 19 at Travis house. Poured from a 22 oz bottle labeled as Stone 11th Anniversary that was produced in 2007. Should be interesting. The pour is great. Its a dark brown with some ruby or garnet shining through and a couple fingers of an off white head that leaves some decently soapy lace. The aroma is definitely oxidized up front. There is some leather, and a little bland old hoppiness. There is a good roast present, and a light bitterness that is sure to have faded over time. I would have liked to try this fresh, but I suppose I can go buy a Sublimely Self Righteous if I feel the need. The flavor is more oxidized. There is a little hoppiness, and maybe some decent roast, but this one had just blended together into a roasty, oxidized fluid with a hint of bitterness. Its disappointing. The mouth feel is thin and light with an off carbonation and a lingeringly roasted, oxidized finish. Might need to get a Sublimely...
Aroma is rosated and hoppy with hints of chocolate and licorice. The smooth and slight grassy hops brings a refreshing taste to this mighty fine brew. Pleasant bitterness.
Very heavy. Super thick and not to hoppy but very even and balanced. Fills the whole mouth and sticks. Tap and bottle

Bottle from Rehills of Jesmond. Pours deep brown, almost black with a big lasting cream head. The aroma is sweet with pine and cocoa. The taste is big and bitter pine followed by smooth dark chocolate. Moderate spice too. Very drinkable. Sublime indeed.

Almost perfect as Black IPA style. Black color and a little bit cloudy. Aroma is very complex, cacao and coffee and a little of fruit. Perfect balance of malts and hops. Vey creamy, blackberries, coffee, dark chocolate, toffee, grapefruit, orange, sweetnes from the caramel malt, bread, pine, roasted notes, and some citrus. Very bitter.
Creamy, oily texture. Medium body e medium carbonation.
This is real Black IPA, no compromise. 
One of my favourite black ipas ever.

Black colour, beige head. Aroma of cacao, red berries, quite fruity, coffee, citrus. Quite bitter flavour, coffee, citrus, hops, grapefruit, pineapple, berries. Finish coffee, straw, fruity hops. Lingering bitter. Nice.(from 66cL bottle @ home. Thanks for the bottle, Tim!)
Pours a black from a bottle with a white head, good lacing. Sweet roasty smell, overly sweet flavor. Bitter finish. Okay beer.

I got this bottle in a Stone Mixe Pack 2014 and Ive tried it before but not reviewed it. This is my last bottle so this is the time to correct this! 

The beer pours dark brow with a red tone and a two finger high beige-brown head that leaves a lot of lacing on the glass! FInally the head sinks down to a 2 mm layer on top of the beer, still creamy and fluffy. 

Nose: Wow! Fantastic nose! Chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, cream, vanilla, orange, alcohol, toffee, butter, herbs, smoke and dried fruit. 
Taste: Oh, this is so creamy and soft! Black berries, coffee, dark chocolate, toffee, grapefruit, orange, sweetnes from the caramel malt, smoke, pine, roasted notes, dark bread, citrus - a LOT of flavours here! 
Body: Medium body and soft carbonation. Creamy, oily texture. Complex flavours. So rich and soft. 

This is an excellent beer!

Most black IPA go straight for very dark, charcoal malts. This was a refreshing IPA with a balance of dark, cola, coffee and bread crust malts which made it much more drinkable. Everything was well balanced, nothing stood out. Nice citrus hop finish. Pairs well with grilled meats, beef, pork, etc.

Jet black pour with tan head. Coffee and hop, aroma. Very well done and n aroma. Taste is very light coffe and dark malts ...obvious hop backend. Slightly dry finish a great blend of hops and dark malts.

650ml bottle enjoyed @ my vacation apartment. Pours very dark brown with a big and frothy beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, sweet, grapefruit and a little herbal. Flavour is medium sweet and light bitterness. Medium bodied, thick bodied, average carbonation. Finish is sweet and hoppy.
Pours deep black with a tan head. Roasted malt and piney aroma. Dark roasted malt flavors balanced by piney hops. Hoppy finish lingers on the palate. Balanced.
Rated based on notes taken 20 May 2012 -- This is a great black IPA. Hops everywhere with a great malt base that isnt overcome by the hops.

Dark brown pour from a bottle. Small light brown head. Piney aroma with hint of roast. Hints of the roast malt backbone but the piney citrus hop is dominant. Lingering pine and chocolate roast finish. (you will be missed)

Pours black with a nice frothy pale head. Head retention is excellent. Aroma of malt, hops, pine, slight citrus, spice, alcohol, very slight soy sauce and smoke. Flavors of spice, hop bitterness, slight citrus, caramel, alcohol, smoke, vanilla and very slight but pleasant sour notes. Its just an awesome brew. Almost taste like a BA brew. With stone updating their recipes I wonder if they will make a 2.0 of this brew.

Bottle at home, bomber finished all by myself and boy was I glad to. Thanks tderoeck for the bottle. Together with Wookey Jack this must be the best Black IPA I've had up to date. Bitter as hell, roasted malts. The way I like my Black IPA's. More leaning towards the IPA-style. Absolutely lovely.

Botella. Courtesy of Lowenbrau. BBD: 17-03-2015
Color negro, espuma blanca. Cuerpo medio. Final amargo.

12fl oz bottle. 23-04-2015.
Enjoy by 17-03-2015 (yes, really short expiry time...)
Courtesy of Javi ificould.
In short: nice black ipa.
Pours black with nice tan head, creamy and compact. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Herbal nose. Medium body, average carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is moderate bitter, dry, herbal, some roasty notes. A nice black ipa, but not the best i had.

Bottle 12 oz at Cika Boban Tasting in Vranovo Serbia.01.04.2015.Taste with cika Boban himself and my bro ippopotamo36!Thank you Alberto and Greek connection?s for this bottle.Pour it daek color with small white head.Taste and aroma of roasted malt, hoppy note, some pepper, cereals.Smooth finish good balanced.Good

This is a classic example of hype ruining a decent beer. For whatever reason I missed this one at the Anniversary party and managed to go 7 more years without trying it. Now that its going to be retired I felt like I had to, especially with a 100 rating! Totally overrated! Its a simple black ipa, which has been over hopped. Its one dimensional. Looking forward to Stones new beers since this one is going out of rotation.

Clear, deep copper, tall amd persistent head. 
Full body, intense flavors, smooth texture, nice alcohol heat, outstanding mouthfeel with perfect balance and good length. 
Very bitter but well supported by malty sweetness. 
Roast and caramel flavors overshadow hops but are nicely complementary. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At a great tasting in Vranovo-Serbia, with markoijelena and cika Boban. Bottle. Many thanks to Costantin from the Hoppy imp. Greece. Pours brownish black with an ivory foamy head which leaves drafts when lowers. Nose: roasted malts, orange peel. Mouth: juicy malty feel, Sweet and citrusy as well.
Just a crap beer, thankful Stone came to their senses!! Bye bye....

Fairly dark black, border line cola color with half finger light khaki head. Smells of rye, dark malt, anise, piney hops, a little dark fruit. Taste is a dark grain/rye like bitter, burnt charred, cigarette ash, anise, a tiny bit of coffee and chocolate, pine hops. Good representation of the style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Svart jordig färg. Liten smutsbrun skumkrona. Doft av rostad malt. Rå besk smak. Torkade fikon, salmiak och starkt kaffe.
Flaska från Sebbe. Svart med beige skum. Doft av choklad, fikon och karamell. Torr med smak av choklad, kaffe och lång beska.
Flaska systembolaget. Brun kulör med doft av kakao, fikon och rostad malt. Kraftig smak med bra humlebett. Kaffe, mörk choklad och kavring.

From the bomber, nice high collar on the pour. Hoppy and some surprising fruit accompanies this gritty, dark marvel of a concoction. Its like having a strong stout without all the annoying sweetness and malt one usually gets. Spicy and strong. "It aint bragging if you can back it up" Dizzy Dean.

Bottle @ Cardinal. Clear dark amber body with a medium sized, stable off-white head. Nice aroma, fruity, pine and smooth dark malt and coffee in a really integrated combination. Nice and balanced in flavor as well, dark malt, light roasted coffee, dark chocolate, some caramel, dry fruit, citric fruit, some pine and nice bitterness. Fine body and good aftertaste. A really nice and pleasant BIPA.
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is chocolate, roasted malts, fruit, taste is nice and bitter, malty, roasty finish.

Stone brews some kick ass IPAs, and some imperials that will kick your ass. This righteous ale is everything awesome about their high power IPAs put under a flame and roasted with some coffee chocolate goodness.

Lovely orange choco, cassis, sweet grapefuit. Rich choco malt, plenty of citrus hop, roasted coffee, berries, touch of mint, peppery bitter finish. Outstanding bipa, complex blend of fruity and roasted flavors.

faintly of hops and coffee. dark in color. slightly lighter than a stout and with reddish undertones. the aftertaste is a bit wonky for me for some reason and it lasts for a long time.. its still a good beer though.

Deep black, large beige head. Aroma is biscuity and herbal. Similar herbal flavours, treacle sweetness, figs, bitter lemon. Medium to full bodied, moderate and fine carbonation. Hides the high abv well. Brilliantly balanced. Lovely.

Fra flaske på Cardinal Mi2 feb-15: vi lukker øynene og smasker uhemmet, dette er salliggjørende snob fra ende til annen. Røstet malt, rosiin, lakris kvalitetskaffe og lekker sjokolade sammen med dye god humle, og allikevel så lett på foten.
Aroma has an initial familiar medicinal scent that I cant place, something hydrogen peroxide-ish. Taste is not sweet, but a nice roasty and savory taste.
Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 23.02.15. Almost black. Pale, brown head. Aroma and taste of bitter grapefruit and fresh pine. A slight hint of liquorice. Rather good.
Big hop brew for Black IPA...matched the nice roast and bitterness. Somewhat floral aroma matched the coffee. Dry finish excellent carbonation best black IPA I have had.

Black pour with a beautiful khaki head. Nose is roasted throughout, a little smoky, roasted malts and more dark flavors with a neath green hop. Flavor is more toast and road and darkness with liveliness of green hop and pine. Really enjoyable and Ill miss it when its gone.

330ml bottle at home. Dark brown almost black color with nice dark beige head. Aroma is hoppy, herbal spicy, mint, piney, light roasted malty, caramel. Sweet and bitter taste like the aroma, mostly hoppy herbal spicy, light roasted malty when it gets warmer. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2015 Poured from 22 oz bomber. Pours black with an off white head. Aroma is fruity citrus, grapefruit & pine with a light roasted smokiness. Flavor starts off citrus with some tropical fruit flavors and finishing with grapefruit and pine hops. Then the roasted malt smokiness and chocolate flavors sneak up on the backside of this brew. Stone, why oh why would you take this beer away from us?

Pours a clear dark brown, almost black with some ruby in there when held up to a light. There is a nice two-finger head with good retention and left plenty of lacing around the glass. The aroma earthy hops, dark roasted malts, and some sweetness. The taste is hop oil, a bit of bitterness, dark roasted malts, dark chocolate, and dark coffee. The mouthfeel is on the medium to heavy side. The alcohol is not very noticeable in this beer as well.
Poured into shaker pint. ..... Pours black with nice tan head................. . ....

Love this style love this brew so sad to hear it will be no longer. Huge earthy hop aroma coupled with great coffee nose. Tast so well balance of nice roast and hops. Perfect carbonation and perfect dry finish. Get it while you can
Peaches and hops dominate this ones olfactory presence. Hipsters beware, youll like this. Its a fine BIPA.

One-third sample, keg at The 23 Club. Near black coloured body. Fair fawn-coloured head, mostly remaining. Smell of mid-sweet vanilla, dark fruits and grainy malts. Rich taste profile of vanilla chocolate, coffee and liquorice followed by dark fruity bitterness to a prolonged ending. Smooth and warming on the swallow. Full bodied. Delicious (Liverpool 31.01.2015).
Bottle pours coffee-black, roasted, chocolatey nose, palate full-bodied, ending in a roasted malt bitterness. Overall, its like a stout with IPA hops.

Look: pours a dark deep brown. Amber highlights when held up to the light. Light tan head. Very thick and pillowy that hangs around a while. Thick lacing.
Smell: roasted malts. Dank hops. Coffee.
Taste: hops. Dank. Grapefruit. Roasted malt. Coffee.
Feel: rather thick mouth feel for an IPA. Medium carbonation. 
Overall: nice beer. Would like more hops. But a good balance.
First drank: home 2/7/15 
Vintage: 2014
Bottle at home. Toasty, Malty and hoppy. Chocolate, coffee, citrus, vanilla taste. A bit stout-ish. Smooth boozy finish. Delicious :)

1pt 6fl oz @ brauhaus, Edinburgh. Body is dark brown, head is big rocky, tan, fully lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is citrus, aroma is dried fruits, caramel, chocolate, mild coffee, licorice, vanilla, herbs. Light sweet, heavy roasty and hoppy bitter, light fruity sour. Full body, dry texture, soft carbonation. Excellent dessert beer, takes some time to drink, very good balance.

330 ml bottle. Pours deep mahogany, dark brown. Head is minimal, brownish beige, leaving nice lacings. Aroma is not too strong at first, some lactic roast aromas mainly, a bit of hop freshness, sweet cocoa chocolate too. Taste is bitter as an IPA should be but it is difficult to tell if this bitterness is coming from hops or from burnt roastiness. I guess they fit together almost perfectly. Body is there but not too much or not too little. There is burnt rye, hops by the basket, dark fruits and finish is actually quite short and leaves some burnt rye bread taste to linger for a while. Alcohol should be significant - it has after all 8,7% - but is almost not noticeable. This is very very nice, too bad that Stone has decided to discontinue this beer.
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!

12oz bottle, very nice deep dark color, thick prevailing head, this is not something you just drink. Sip and savor. I pored one at the wrong time of night, already had 3 beers in me and wasn't ready for this atom bomb of flavor. I'll have to stock up before they stop production

Aromas excelentes. Notas a frutas cítricas y tropicales. De igual forma se perciben notas herbales, principalmente pino.

Su apariencia es completamente negra, bien carbonatada, cuerpo medio, corona de espuma media de baja retención.

En boca es suave, herbal y un amargor intenso.

Al paladar es excelente. Notas cítricas se perciben en primera instancia, sin embargo las notas herbales y el fuerte amargor se perciben de principio a fin.

En resumen se trata de una joya de cerveza. Una black Ipa en todo el sentido de la palabra. El amargor a pesar de ser intenso, no es agresivo y se equilibra bien con las maltas especiales utilizadas.
Excelente!

Bottle from a mix-pack. Pours out a opaque ruby-black. Thick tan head. Aroma of spice and malts. Flavor is intense, bitter like coffee grounds. Some pine notes. Some earthy burnt notes. Thick mouthfeel but smooth drinking.

W aromacie owoce tropikalne i żywice stłumione przez nuty ciemnego słodu uderzające w przypalony karmel i lekki sos sojowy, co prawdopodobnie wskazuje na utlenienie. W smaku pełne, czekoladowo - karmelowe z początkowo niezbyt uwydatnioną goryczką, która swą żywiczno - leśną potęgę ujawnia dopiero na finiszu. Fajnie zbalansowane, lekko rozgrzewające. Świeższe mogłoby niszczyć, choć i tak jest nieźle.
Bottle pour at home. Dark black pour, dark IPA with lot of deep flavor. Solid beer.
I love IPAs and Porters. This takes almost all characteristics I love about them. Great black IPA.
A GREAT BEER. ONE OF THE BEST IPAS ON THE MARKET. BEST AT ROOM TEMP. OTHER BREWERS MUST LEARN FROM STONE ON HOW TO BREW GREAT BEER.

Ive had this a few times now. A very different BIPA for mine. Super piney and grapefruit flavours and abit grassy. But also blended well with some chocolate, coffee and bitter vanilla. If youre a fan of the style this is great

stable and dense leight beige head fades with foamhead and lacing. coffee coloured. aroma is hop, resin, centannial in yo face, vanilla and boozy. taste like aroma, bitter, very bitter, too bitter, spicy and wry. medium body and lots of carbonation. bottle 65cl

Bottle.

A- Hoppy, spices, malty, roasty.

A- Black color, dark liquid, tan head.

T- Very bitter, malty, roasty, spices, caramel.

P- Full body, sharp texture, average carbonation, spiced bitter finish.

O- Wow. The bottle I had was well past the best by date and it still kicked you in the face. If you like bitterness this is a good choice. I didnt expect to like it as I dont go crazy over Stone and IPA is far from my favorite style but this one was pretty solid. Lots of hops and spice make this a well balanced brew.
ANOTHER GREAT BEER FROM STONE THE JUST KEEP PUTTING THEM OUT . FINISHES VERY WELL
Up front it pours black, smells like hops, and tastes effing Iincredible.....must be a stone. Very roasty and extremely bitter.
Supreme beer, fresh stone hop aroma, backed by a great malt backbone, fantastic.
Chocolate and vanilla, lingering bitterness, syrupy palate. Very impressive beer.
From a bottle. Pours thick dark brown, thin lasting tan head, rich roasted flavours with only a mild lingering bitterness. Dangerously drinkable.
Pours black with a small tan head. Hoppy and malty aroma. Charred malt and citrus bitterness, pine, light coffee taste. Heavy feel and lingering bitterness on the tongue. Good beer
One of the best black IPAs out there. Great balance with the dark malts, pale and hops. I think this is what Greg Noonan is drinking up in heaven.
Nice head and very nice dark color. Not bitter yet a slight hop taste of hop. Very nice beer.

Appearance is very dark, almost black. A 1-2 finger light brown head which gradually fades, leaving some lacing. Aroma- lots of hops. Orange, some grapefruit, a bit of malt, pine. Smells just like an IPA. Taste- hop bitterness, orange peel, pine, bitter fruit, hints of milky chocolate, iced coffee, a lasting, fruit-filled, bitter finish. Complex and delicious.

Bottle at Our Black Heart, Camden on 30 Jul 2012. Poured a really dark brown, with a big beige head. Aroma of citrus hops, pine needles and dark chocolate. Full mouthfeel. Big, complex flavours of berries, some smokiness, dark malts and bitter, grassy hops. Finish was a great mix of bitter burnt malts, resinous hop and some treacle.

Great malty high Gravity IPA w dark malts in the mash. So the favor is quite a bit divergent yet still an IPA. I like it. Not as hoppy as some IPA or double IPA styles. What you taste is the malt to hop ratio so that needs to be considered for a high Gravity IPA. 
I am still trying to find a Dark IPA like I remember Petes Wicked Ale contract brewed by August Schell in New Ulm, MN. This comes pretty close!
Dark black in color, smells very hoppy but you also get the lighter roasted malts and some dark fruit, slight chocolate. Classic Stone bitterness but smoothed out a bit. Easy drinking for 8.7%

This pours a very dark brown/black color with a foamy light brown head. The aroma is rich and hoppy. The flavor is rich and bold with deep robust tone but still very hoppy. This finishes with an oak after taste and leaves a lingering bitterness. Very well made for the style.

Draft at Logans Alley - pours a dark brown with dark tan head . Floral , Roasty aroma . Taste is most earthy and roast . Ok . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Part of a Stone mixed 12. Pour is very dark. Looks like a porter or stout in the glass. Nice head, decent lacing. Definitely on the bitter side, but for me still a good beer. Another fine beer from Stone.
UPDATED: NOV 27, 2014 Bit OH taste and slightly unpleasant after taste. Not my preferred style. Bit taste without the greenness of the hops. Not saying it?s a bad beer, just that is not for me.

I normally like black IPAs but this one I did not enjoy. It doesnt have enough sweetness or citrus to balance out the bitterness. It does have a very crisp finish that I appreciated but aside from that this is for more bitter IPA lovers.
Pours black with tan head. Aroma has hop and roasty malts. Taste has nice bitterness balanced with roastiness.

Appearance: Black color with a nice off white head. Nice lacing. Aroma: Fruity, hoppy and toffee.Palate: Full body. Tad sweet and a fine bitterness. Soft to average carbonation.Taste: Toffee, coffee, hoppy, fruity and roasted.Overall impression: Tasty ok BIPA.Personal stats: Bottle from a trade with tony_gorilla

22oz bottle. Pours a very deep brown color with a one finger of tan head with fantastic retention, that slowly fades to leave lots of foamy lace on the glass. The aroma is big and robust with nice hoppy and roasted smells. There are lots of roasted malts as well as a bit of coffee. Along with the darker aromas is a great dose of hops, with a big grapefruit hop aroma accompanied by some nice pine and earthy hops as well. Rounding out the aroma are hints of sweet molasses. The aroma fools the palate as the first thing you taste is a beautifully heavy malt presence. The sweetness quickly transitions to a nice hop bite followed by a lingering hop bitterness. This is a very nicely balanced Black IPA that showcases the hops but doesnt overpower the malt. Full bodied with medium-low carbonation.

What a good beer. Pour is dark chocolate in color white a full off white to tan head. Aroma is a good combination citrus,herbal and dry hop. Earthy flavors rule your taste buds with a big citrus splash that finishes with a subtle sweetness that makes for great balance.

Four ounce pour at the Stone Bistro. Pours a rich black with superb roasty notes.

Pint bottle from whole foods naples. Pours black with reddish hue. Lovely foam two finger tan head. Aroma spruce, pine up front. Behind is leather, floral, slight smoke. Smells great. Flavour is smooth chocolate hazelnut, with a resinous hop floral hit. Big lasting bitterness leads to a dry coffee finish. The mouthfeel is velvet cream. It is very moreish. Carbonation is low but there. Great balance between the burnt malts and the IPA. A great beer.

Pours black with light brown head. Aroma of citrus, chocolate and some roasted, smokey notes. Very smooth and balanced, but yet complex taste. A superb beer.

Medium-strong, quite sweet and alcohol flavored aroma with raisin, malts and chocolate. Black color with light-medium, long staying, beige head. Strong though smooth taste with some sweetness. Raisin, syrup, malts, chocolate and coffee in semi-roasted style. Some alcohol flavor suits for this beer. Also a bit of hops but in very balanced manner concerned with other flavors. Medium-wide taste spectrum and long, bit fruity, malty and hoppy aftertaste. Medium mouth feel and medium-low carbonation. A perfect beer.

Now this is what all Black IPAs should be!!! Makes sense coming from a natural IPA maker in Stone brewing...pours a clear black almost opaque color with a big frothy brown head that leaves lot of lace on the glass. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, citrus, grapefruits & pine on the nose all in a big complex beautiful balance. Taste is roasted malts mixed with citrus hops mixed with cocoa mixed with pine mixed with coffee mixed with grapefruit...well you get the idea complex and balanced with a semi dry to dry finish which makes this the best Stone beer Ive had to date. Absolutely love this beer!

Aroma: resin, ripe fruits, floral hops. Appearance: black, small, creamy, beige head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: buttes intensify, turning dry, chocolate, some intense sweets coming up as well, very complex Overall: nice Black IPA, excellent palate. Pint at Stone Brewing World Bistro & Gardens - Liberty Station, San Diego.
Nice combination of grape, roastiness, chocolate and vanilla. Malty chocolate sweetness is in nice balance with the hoppy bitterness. A really nice black IPA when drunk fresh

Transfer from BA review on 3-18-14-

 Poured from bottle into a snifter

 Appearance  The beer pours a very deep brown color bordering on black with a one finger of tan colored head. The head has a fantastic level of retention, slowly fading to leave a great level of foamy lace on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma of the beer is big and robust of some nice hoppy and roasted smells. There are lots of roasted malt smell as well as some other darker aromas of a bit of coffee. Along with the darker aromas is a great dose of hop, with a grapefruit hop aroma the heaviest, but being accompanied by some nice pine and earthy hop smells as well. Rounding out the smell is just some hints of sweeter aromas with some light orange smells as a hint of molasses.

 Taste  The taste starts with a rather roasty malt flavor with some coffee and a bit of a caramel sweetness. An earthy and pine hop flavor are present right from the start, beginning the taste with a rather decent hop flavor. As the taste advances, the hop grows more and more intense with the lighter level of caramel sweetness that was also present right at the start of the flavor fading a bit. A bit of a grapefruit hop flavor grows on the tongue as the flavor advances, but the biggest hop flavor increase comes with the pine flavors as they really grow quite potent toward the end of the taste. Along with the increase in the hop, the roasted flavors grow stronger as well as growing a bit grainier and burnt in nature. With the mix of roasted flavors and the rather big pine and other hop flavors, one is left with a rather robust, darkly hopped flavor to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the thicker and chewier side with a carbonation level that is on the lower side. Both are very nice for the mix of pine hop and darker flavors and make for a great sipping, but still very drinkable dark IPA.

 Overall  A rather tasty and moderately stronger black IPA. It had a nice blend of big pine hop flavors and roasted malt that would leave one craving either of these flavors (if not both) rather satisfied.

Big bottle, pours clack with a creamy head. Coffee and toast the nose with lingering coffee and chocolate to taste. Not usually a IPA guy but I do enjoy this beer.

Keg. Black with a large good lacing light brown head. Lots of cheesy, citrusy and flowery hop notes, darker malt in the back; caramel, dark chocolate, cocoa. Medium body, medium sweet and bitter with a long dry hoppy finish. It's good, but I wish the hops were less cheesy. Still a pleasant drink.
Flaska privatimport. Kolsvart vätska. Fruktig och frisk med en mörkrostad ubderton som inte tar över. Riktigt bra

Kolsvart med ganska lätt skum men som klistrar sig fast på glaset. 
Rökig och humlig i doften.
Torkad frukt och rökighet i smaken. 
Kraftfull beska och en låååång eftersmak.

Traded for a bottle from my brother in-law. Pours a cola like colour with a fluffy khaki head, clingy lace. Nose is very hoppy, as a typical ipa should be. Tastes a touch malty, but citrus and pine bitter, the maltiness comes through again in the finish. Really nice.
Appearance is black with hints of deep reddish-brown. Aroma is citrus hops, taste is roasted malts with coffee/cocoa and a bracing bitterness, and a lingering roasty finish. Top tier Black IPA.

Bottle from AlesByMail.co.uk

Dark brown body, with a medium, creamy, tan head.
Great aroma with loads of fruits like citrus, peach, berries, tropical fruits, some pine and also many smooth, dark malts like melting chocolate, nuts, earth, some wood.
Taste follows this, also a great blend of the tasty, fruity hops and very smooth dark malts.
Mouthfeel is medium to full, surprisingly creamy, with a medium carbonation and it finishes bitter, roasty, with lots of citrus and dark malts.

Delicious! Wonderful blend of fruity hops and dark malts and very smooth to drink, with a well hidden ABV. One of the very best Black IPAs Ive had so far!

35,5cl bottle at Tilt, Oslo. Pours black with a fairly small, light beige head. Dark roasty aroma with lots of hops too. Dark chocolate, pine, citrus and hints of coffee, dark fruits and herbs. Medium sweet with lots of flavours hoppy and malty in a nice and balanced mixture. Finishes fairly bitter with citrusy notes. Surprisingly smooth and well balanced. Medium bitter aftertaste. Very nice BIPA!

Poured from a 12 oz bottle with a Best By date of 12/25/2014. 
Aroma is mostly hoppy with a lot of grapefruit and pine resin, a classic West Coast hop character. Some cracker malt notes with faint roast and light chocolate. Light ester notes of stone fruit. 
Pours dark brown, almost black with a medium sized, fairly thick, dark tan head that exhibits pretty nice retention. 
Flavor is slightly sweet with some faint roast and light chocolate notes, both of which are more prevalent in the finish. Medium high bitterness with quite a bit of resinous and grapefruit hop character. Some light notes of stone fruit, orange and woods. Light alcohol spice in the finish. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, an alright black IPA, but I still dont see why Black IPAs are a thing. I would rather have a super fruity IPA than a slightly roasty resin bomb.
Great hoppy aroma that worked well with the coco malts. The taste was hoppy bitter and roasty bitter, but not over the top. Excellent job!

Quick question. What doesn't this brewery do right? This is an awesome creation in the black IPA category, which is my favorite. Great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A great, big bomber pour! All black body, thin, lacy head.
Very hoppy aroma, with hints of smoke, alcohol, pine, roasty malts.
Quite a bit of hops presence and bite in the initial taste, then rolls to a smooth, slightly flat finish. The dark, roasted notes stick around for a bit, along with a nice, alcohol warmth. 
A nice brew, not overwhelming in any area. Certainly has a kick you can feel by the end of a 22 oz bottle.

22 oz bottle from Fred Meyers in Beaverton, OR. Aroma is sweet and woody, with strong hints of burned coffee. Sweetness in the beginning gets immediately overtaken by the astringency of the roasted grains and the bitterness of the hops. I would not necessarily call this beer balanced, but I would certainly call it complex. Then again, I prefer sweeter Black IPAs, and I dont generally care for overly dry and astringent roasted grains. Regardless, I would gladly drink this again. And again.

Poured from a 22. Aroma has an initial familiar medicinal scent that I cant place, something hydrogen peroxide-ish. Taste is not sweet, but a nice roasty and savory taste. This is a great beer but not sure if it is 100% worthy.
Ballsy black IPA. Some black IPAs are light on hops, not this one. It packs a serious hop wallup. Creamy malt backbone gives this a great taste. One of the best IPAs out there.
Bomber. Dank cheesy aromas. Little roastiness. Taste is milk choco then bang with the spicy funky hops. Very smooth for a BIPA. Wow this is great.

Bottle. Black. Big bitter roasty notes that linger on the palate. Chocolate and coffee with citrus hops. Low carb and a medium mouthfeel. Probably my favorite black ipa to date. Classic stone hoppy bite with dark rich malts.

Jet Black. Frothy head. Licorice taste from the mix of hops and malt. Roasted and a little like jerky. Nice!
Pitch black with a beautiful huge off white frothy head. Malty nose but light. Roasted malt and coffee taste, light bitterness, slick and long lingering. Nice
Pours a nice dark brown with caramel colored head. Aroma of molasses, a bit of spice, and some pine. Flavor matches aroma.

Wow, surprised I hadnt ticked this. Keg @ Sedona. Deep brown with a small head. Orange creamsicle, charrred malt. Taste is similar. Herbal hop, some grass. Roast coffee. Orange peel and candies. Medium body, soft carb. Ok.

1pt 6 fl oz bottle. Ruby-tinged black colour, frothy beige foam head leaving lacing and aroma of citrus, grassy hop, roast malt, caramel. This beer is pretty good, but not perfect. I would rather drink it than talk to Catholics, but I feel the same way about blood. Stone makes metal beer, like heavy metal, like you drink this beer while listening to Electric Wizard.

Poured from a bottle. Neat black with tan head. Aroma is caramel malt and oak. Taste is moderate sweet followed by a bitter finish. Flavors of roasted malt, chocolate and some bright fruity hops. Nice creamy mouthfeel. Very nice black ipa.

Bottle at The Bishops Arms Gamla Stan, april 17th 2014. Black body with a big tanned head. Aroma of caramel, lots of fruity hops, espresso and pine. Good balance of bitterness and malt. Excellent beer.

Bottle to tulip
Aroma of molasses, tar, grapefruit, a touch of spruce, and lightly toasted malt. It pours a nice reddish brown colour that appears to be strictly red if held to a light. The head is thin, but long lasting and its creamy and light tan. After drinking, theres a good amount of lacing left behind. Taste is caramel, treacle, malt, and a touch of berry sweetness, intermixed with a ton of bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium bodied and chalky. I like the interplay of sweetness and bitterness. This is pretty good.Earlier Rating: 7/12/2014 Total Score: 3.7Bottle to plastic taster at the RBAG14 warmup
After a slew of Stone trivia questions, one about this beer, its time to rate this. Hops, citrus, lots of pine a little spruce. Reddish brown with a long lasting white head. Hoppy, citrus, and lots of caramel.

Bottle at a tasting. Black pour with a caramel creamy head, aroma is strong fruity, light malty, sweet. Taste is malty, alcoholic, light sweetness with light notes of tropical fruits in the background and a bitter finish. Great stuff

Poured from a 22 ounce bottle about three weeks after it's enjoy by date so keep that in mind. Pours a deep black with a nice head that holds for a little while. Smells mostly of hops (mostly grass) with little to no roastiness noticeable. Taste is bitter up front with a balanced hop character and a bit of roasted malt at the very end. It goes down easy and is complex and interesting. You can't really go wrong with this one. Based on this example I would not be scared off if it's a bit past its enjoy by date, especially if you can get a deal.

Half pint at Brewdog Bristol. Poured deep brown, with an enormous creamy white head (it took the barman about 5 minutes to actually get the glass full of beer rather than foam). Aroma is treacle, toast and lightly hoppy. Taste is similar, and a little simplistic. Some citrus comes to the fore, but malt, coffee and treacle are more vividly present. The finish isnt entirely clean.I suspect a lack of freshness from Brewdogs taps is responsible for both that and the suppression of the more hop driven components of this beer. A slight disappointment, but I think the blame lies with Brewdog on this one.

Bottle, picked up at GBBF today. Pours a dark reddy brown/black with a nice, chunky off-white head. Aroma has some light floral stuff going on, a little candy and the malty choc and light coffee stuff is hovering in the background. Medium body, medium carbonation. Lovely orange, lemon hoppiness - some light trop fruit too with a little overripeness. Good, tasty malty flavours - light bitter choc, coffee, a hint of treacle, toast. Balance is pretty much spot on. Tasty stuff.

my favorite black ipa. crisp and smooth. just the right amount of hops and fruit within. this is a winner from stone and one should def. give this a chance.

Pours black with a beige head. Aroma is malt, roastiness, fruit, citrus, grass and hops. Taste is medium sweet leading to a fruit, roasty and hoppy finish. Damn good!
On tap. Black colour. Floral hop aroma. Bittersweet chocolate. Bitter finish.

On tap at BrewDog Cardiff. Sweet & bitter in a glass. An immensely dark beer with enough sweetness to make sure you don't fall into hell. Caramel coffee with slap on the face hops. Oooohhhh!

Fad: Taster på Stone Brewpub. Brunsort klar øl. Duft af amerikansk humle. Fin lille øl men lider af det samme problem alle Black IPA har for mig. En blanding der ikke skulle være foretaget. Ellers meget vellavet øl.

Another delicious Stone offering. Great combo of smoke, coffee, hops, citrus, carbonation, and cherry. Wonderful year round brew thats hearty enough for Winter, yet smooth and crisp enough for Summer.

Black pour with a tan head. Sweet and hoppy aromas. Notes of molasses with citrus and floral hops. Flavor is similar. This beer is a mess. Its like they couldnt decide what type of beer to brew. Another ridiculous black ipa.
12oz bottle to shaker. Dark cola pour. Tan head. Strong caramel chocolate malt flavor with bitter hops in the middle and a sweet finish.

Keg at Brewdog Shepards bush. Aroma is light dank piney hops with nutty and some ashy roast. Nice caramel brown coloured pour, lasting cream head. Palate is nice and full with smooth carbonation. Flavour is nutty, light roast malts, with pine and resin, varnish, warming alcohol. Slightly odd tang to it maybe some dank hop. Big lingering hop bitterness. Really good

Reviewed from notes. 
This was poured into a pint glass and a tulip. There was barely any difference between the two glasses. 
The appearance was a black color with a one finger white to off white foamy head that dissipated within about a minute leaving some light lacing sliding into the beer. 
The smell had a nice roasty bitter coffee to sweet citrusy pine aroma with a rolling light chocolate underneath. 
The taste was sweet citrus to roasty and had the chocolate only come out really underneath. 
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a fair sessionability about it. The carbonation was somewhat sharp but not overbearing.
Overall, I say this was a pretty good black IPA Id have again.
Pours black. Aroma is sweet malts and bitter hops. Taste is slightly sweet with a bitter finish.

Pours obsidian with a creamy tan head; the appearance and aromas foreshadow the richness and depth to come.

Sweet hoppy notes on the nose with molasses, roasted coffee, and burnt sugar. The aroma almost makes me think of an IPA mating with a Barleywine ale. 

This is a strong one which has deep bitterness that hangs on a bit. It's a black IPA that is better than most. 

This beer doesn't want to be too cold. About 55d-60d seems ideal. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Darker ipa than Im use to but still really good. Bitter but not overpowering. Overall a great beer.

The body has an opaque dark black color with a thick light tan head on top. The head is long lasting and makes for tons of cool lacing on the glass. The aroma has solid roasted and toasted maltiness with caramel like sweetness backed up by equally solid citrusy hops. Its deep maltiness sets up a firm base for the hops to work there bitter magic. From the base malt I get firm toasted and roasted character with loads of caramel like sweetness that weaves in and out of the dominate hops. The hops bring a big hit of citrus and pine like bitterness. Notes of grapefruit, lime, bitter orange and pine resin hang onto the tongue long into the slow fading finish. The big full body brings a heavy slow sipping and sticky texture with just enough carbonation to keep things from getting cloying.
Bottle to pint glass. Roast and slight citrus on the nose. Deep and dark with full brown head. Taste is a little too roasty, with the hops in reserve.

Black bodied, beige head. Hugely hoppy aroma, pine and spruce. So much that despite the roasted malts you could identify this as a straight ipa in a blind tasting. Even more so in the taste, very bitter, delicious, rich aroma. Love this style and adore this beer. Well balanced between dark malts yet never dimming down the raw hop appeal. Great brew! (65cl bottle shared with Darren and Bertanne, from Saveur Bière)

Draft @ Yard House. Pleasant, floral aroma. Dark color with ruby highlights. Flavor is floral with a nice citrus taste. Good body. Mostly an IPA, but you can taste a little dark malt in there too. Very nice!

Pours a deep black with no head and seemed like little to no carb. Wasnt a bad thing though. This was a little like a porter to me. Aroma was nice and I caught some sweet malts with caramel and vanilla along with some bitter citrus hops. Taste was very good and all the flavors came together nicely. Nicely bitter and I didnt notice any alcohol in it. Solid offering from a great brewery.

Nicely done black IPA, lots of roast grain and hop bitterness without being overwhelming. Black with abundant beige head, smell mostly of roast grains, hops come in at the taste. Nice mellow bitter finish, some lingers, making you want more.,

Poured from a bomber into a snifter glass darkest black brown with a tan head.
Aroma is roasted sweetness. Slight coffee.
Flavor cocoa sweet with a grassy hops to follow. The burnt roasted bitterness.
Balanced beautifully. Stone did one better than many---if you are a serious black IPA fan.
coffee, roasty, grass, herbs, soy sauce, black, brown foam, light sweetness, very bitter, lightly sour, full body, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter

Tap at Union Rooftop. Deep red brown with a creamy tan head. Strong roasted malts, light chocolate, and viney/resiny hops. Taste starts with a mocha sweetness quickly interrupted with the resiny bitterness. Foamy feel.

I am not a huge fan of Black IPA's or CDA's whatever you like to call them, but this one is an exception. Roasty with hints of chocolate. The bitterness from the hops balances with the bitterness of the malt. Very well balanced beer.
Malty hop aroma. Taste is dark roasty malt, coffee and caramel. Nice hop flavor across the top. Moderate bitter finish. Excellent beer.

Bottle pour. Dark black color with brownish medium head, great lacing. Roasted malts and strong hoppy aroma. Light creamy texture. Taste is much like the aroma, and has a light but long lasting bitter aftertaste.

Black ipas are hard to set expectations for. Its Stine so expect the hop from, check, the coco nib and malt pull through a good bit. It would fall in the middle of the pack on black ipas that I have had. Hop in the dark still ranks as the most memorable black of recent tastings.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2015 Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com shared with friends. Color: deep black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: high caramel, roasted malt domination with good equilibrium of hops and grassy notes. Licorice. Good nose! Great! Taste: nice licorice domination with grass and pine. On tap @ Stone Brewery, Escondido - CA. Color: deep dark black beer with small carbonation and small brown head. Smell: roasted malt and caramel. Notes of licorice, and black bread. Taste: very exeptionnal and well balance of malt and hops. Grassy notes, and licorice with finish of malt. Aftertaste: grassy and dry bitterness with caramel and roasted malt.

Bottle from Petaluma Market. Completely black appearance with a biege-white head. Aroma is of pine and grapefruit with some chocolate and coffee also present. Creamy taste, lots of grapefruit initially, then the chocolate, coffee and vanilla comes in and it all comes together with a nice big bitter finish. Tastes no where near 8.7%! Really delicious. Glad I tried this!

22 oz. bottle from Natures Way Market. Dark brown bordering on black with thin lasting tan head. Aroma is the classic Stone pine and citrus hop nuances. Notes of charred chocolate malt and ash. 
Flavor of coffee grounds, earthy dirty chocolate malt, mild traces of citrus and pine needles of a light lingering bitter finish. Moderate amount of bitterness that has a nice balance with the dark malts. (One reason I love the style is the dark malts with a healthy bitterness) Body is leaning on full. Texture is lightly oily with wet hop oils and pine. This is remarkable for a nationally distributed brew, awesome example for what a Black IPA should be. Finely crafted.
Black with thin off-white head. aroma is roasty malts and pine. Flavor is dark chocolate, dark fruit, roast, and pine. This has a great, complex flavor.

Ill be the low rater on this one. I like IPAs, and the bigger the better, but this one doesnt do it for me. Very bitter and burnt malts. Dark pour. Medium mouthfeel. From bottle. I may try it again, but this time it hit me the wrong way.

5/29/14 at CBO. Really liked this one. $3.29 bottle drank in store one of the better balanced black IPAs I've had. Great mix of hop and malts.

A colablack beer with a big, beige and clouding head. The aroma is great, grapefruits and pine needles, liquirice, some tropical fruits. The balance is great in the aroma, the "black nuancees" are not dominating. Taste is strongly bitter, pine needles and some resin, dry roastiness, grapefruits. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Very smooth, velvet like to drink, enjoyable. The great beer, enough of bitterness, succesfully balance and velvet palate gives the final touch.

Perfect pour with light tan head that retains a lot of lacing. The 90 IBU's are definitely present in the bitterness but very balanced and complemented by a hint of coffee and caramel. Very well crafted.
A solid Black IPA. Dark brown, with scarlet hints. Off-white foamy head that leaves some lacing. Light malt nose. Fruity hops, with some roasted malts. Medium carbonation and nice mouthfeel. Tasty.

22oz bomber with a best by date of 8/28/2014. AP: very dark brown with ruby tinges under light; pours with a tan head. AR: strong pine, red grapefruit, mandarin oranges and toasted malt. TA: clash of bitter citrus notes and roasted malts, bittersweetness of dark chocolate and earthy tones at the back end. MO: medium bodied, medium carbonation and actually quite dry in the finish. OV: great black IPA, good balance of the bitter hop notes and roasted malt character.
Bomber. Dark with a tan head. Malt and spicy hops. Sweet chocolate and some hop bitterness.

Pours a deep cola red with two fingers of persistent tan head, heavy lacing. Nose is piney and earthy hops with a hint of citrus, dark roasty malt, coffee and chocolate. Taste starts out with sweet malt but is quickly overtaken by astringent dry bitterness. Medium bodied and creamy, with a lingering bitter finish and gentle warming.

Wow - big and bombastic, sublimely self-righteous, indeed. Take all the best characteristics of stout and IPA, and combine. No caramel malt here, its all dark and roasty goodness. I dont care if it makes me look like an amateur with the RateBeer crowd, I dont see theres any possible way to improve on this, and so dont see how I can give this anything less than a perfect score.

Pours jet black with a mocha head.
Aromas of rum soaked raisins, pine resin.
Tastes of raisins with bitter hops. Some molasses.
Overall very hard to describe with flavors not quite like anything I have experienced.

Best before June 5, 2014.
Appearance: The body appears black but through light a deep clear garnet hue is shown. The tan head explodes from the body with excellent retention.
Aroma: Piney and grapefruit immediately with prominent roast, sweet malts and caramel. Very nice smelling actually, nicely balanced and enticing.
Taste: Caramel and chocolate are prominent up front, but not huge in flavor. Overlying the malt base is a piney/earthy mild to moderate bitterness. Dark chocolate and raisins are on the finish.
Palate: Medium bodied, mild to moderate carbonation.
Overall: A little past date, but Stone puts such short enjoy by dates anyway. This tastes a tad oxidized, but overall its very nice. Ill try this fresher for sure.

The standard for excellence in a black ipa. Roasted malt, citrus/ piney hops. Burnt lemon, pale malts, smoke, caramel, blackend toast. Balanced, with a long hoppy finish. One of the most popular black IPAs, and for a reason, its excellent!

650 ml bottle (enjoy by 7/10/14) poured into nonic pint. Deep cola color with an impressive three-finger creamy light beige head that seems to last forever. Aroma is resinous, piney hops with roasted malt undertones. Flavor follows suit, with initial hoppiness giving way to roasted complexity. The mouthfeel is much creamier than I was expecting. While I dont enjoy this quite as much as Stones standard IPA offerings, its still great.

Smells like a DIPA, only better. It has subtle roasty chocolate qualities. The hops are still there, but you can tell theres a lot more going on. Interesting contrast in appearance - the beer is jet black with a nearly white head. The foam just refuses to go away. Taste is similar to the smell. Roast and bitter chocolate up front, some soy sauce and faint black licorice with an aftertaste that has the signature Stone assault on the taste buds. The palate is better than most IPAs - perhaps Im biased; dark beers always seem to have a better palate in my opinion. Black IPAs are hit and miss with me, but this is one of the better ones I have tried. Right now, Im thinking it is even better than Firestone Walker Wookey Jack.

Flaska @ Ölrepubliken. Smutsvitt skum ovan en Coca-colafärgad vätska. Dofter av citrus, ananas, espresso och lakrits. Smakinslag av grapefrukt, passionsfrukt, mörk choklad, läder och kåda. För egen del är det aningen för mycket kolsyra, men det är mer en randanmärkning: Detta är en mycket god BIPA, och därmed en mycket god öl. Medelstor beska, en maltsötma som balanserar upp den och en både fruktig och lätt rökig eftersmak.
22 Fl. OZ ($6.99) A very good beer, its an ale that thinks its an IPA. very hoppy and great taste. I love this beer and its a good 8.7% if you see this try it out.

Hop aroma mix with a chocolate almost cocoa aroma in this black brew with a tan head of tiny bubble. The taste is choc syupy hops with a good combo of sweet and bitter.
